body_html:
Commit tensorflow/models@5f99e58 fixes the batch norm issues.

In regards to your question about differences in training/inference: the PR I am submitting demonstrates how to take advantage of a custom argument such as is_training. Note that this behavior is already supported in the GANEstimator, where a generator or discriminator that has a special argument called mode will have the mode passed to it.

body:
Commit https://github.com/tensorflow/models/commit/5f99e5893d6d72e6161a3c32d3d6e3e7fc3bbe4d fixes the batch norm issues.

In regards to your question about differences in training/inference: the PR I am submitting demonstrates how to take advantage of a custom argument such as `is_training`. Note that this behavior is already supported in the GANEstimator, where a generator or discriminator that has a special argument called `mode` will have the mode passed to it.
